The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: After 7 years of waiting\, and watching NO leaks because you wanted to enjoy the game at your own pace and at your own enjoyment.So you get up in the morning\, you’re brimming with excitement because the game you waited so long for is finally here. You pick up your pre order\, you start the game and you’re discovering new characters and that’s fine because it’s TLOU universe. You start playing Joel and nostalgia fills your heart and you save a girl named Abby from some infected with your brother Tommy and you follow her to her safehouse and there\, Abby shoots you in the leg and tortures you and bashes your head with a golf club. You die. 2 hours into the game.And now you play as Ellie and they make you kill a dog\, you are given no choice in this\, and the same dog is playing with Abby. Manipulative much?You play as Abby for a good 40% of the game\, even if you are still angry at the character\, you are forced to play her. You understand her journey\, but you (my choice) still resent her for what she did to Joel. You are back as Ellie and you go on your journey of revenge and you set off killing people who are affiliated with Abby. In the end\, you are made to fight Ellie as Abby and you are meant to hurt her\, the beloved character you have grown so much to love.The final moments of the game is Ellie letting Abby live\, and “realising” that revenge is bad and they we should break the circle.
